author: tersec
content: It also transfers more naturally to the VC <-> BN communication, of course

author: tersec
content: That said, I'm not convinced this flexibility or runtime mutability is much of a real advantage -- it creates an environment where it's appealing to, say, start treating some field as optional even though it's semantic nonsense, or avoid creating a new call or properly treating a response JSON type as distinct even when it definitely is, and to just push that back to some implicit disambiguation done at JSON parsing time (pre-Altair eth2 had some problems here, mostly fixed).

author: tersec
content: The very up-front rigidity of SSZ can be advantageous in that regard, in making it clear that if one wants to return anything that's not an exact 1:1 mapping of the underlying SSZ type (which also can't randomly change), then one needs to define a new RPC method.
